Although the [[statute of limitations]] on the case expired in 2006, police continue to investigate for historical reasons. *On Monday, 1 April 1991, at 23:30, [[Detlev Karsten Rohwedder|Detlev Rohwedder]], president of the German organization [[Treuhandanstalt]], was shot and killed through a window on the first floor of his house in the suburb of [[Düsseldorf-Niederkassel]] by the first of three rifle shots. [[West Germany|West German]] [[Far-left politics|far-left]] militant group [[Red Army Faction]] (RAF) claimed responsibility for this act, but the sniper was never identified. In 2001, a [[DNA analysis]] found that hair strands from the crime scene belonged to RAF member [[Wolfgang Grams]]. The [[Attorney General of Germany|Attorney General]] did not consider this evidence sufficient to name Grams as a suspect of the killing though. *[[Karmein Chan]] (13), was abducted from her family's home in [[Templestowe, Victoria]] by an unidentified man who was later dubbed "[[Mr. Cruel]]" by [[Melbourne]] newspapers on 13 April 1991. Her body was discovered on 9 April 1992, in [[Thomastown, Victoria|Thomastown]], she had been shot in the head. Although [[Victoria Police]] knew a great deal about the perpetrator from previous, non-fatal child abductions and rapes dating back to 1985,<ref>{{cite news |last=Moor |first=Keith |date=2012-04-11 |title=Mr Cruel suspected of at least a dozen attacks on children |url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/law-order/mr-cruel-suspected-of-at-least-a-dozen-attacks-on-children/story-fnat7jnn-1226323143197 |newspaper=The Herald Sun |location=Melbourne, Victoria |publisher=News Limited |accessdate=2014-05-11}}</ref> there has never been enough evidence to charge any of the 27,000 men interviewed at the time.<ref>{{cite news |author=[[John Silvester (writer)|Silvester, John]] |date=2006-04-07 |title='Mr Cruel' filmed his victims, say police |url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/national/mr-cruel-filmed-his-victims-say-police/2006/04/07/1143916721667.html?page=fullpage#contentSwap2 |newspaper=The Age |location=Melbourne, Victoria |publisher=Fairfax |accessdate=2014-05-11}}</ref> The case is still open with a second police operation, Taskforce Apollo, formed in 2010 to examine new evidence and material from the original Operation Spectrum.<ref>{{cite news |last=Dowsley |first=Anthony |date=2010-12-14 |title=Net closes on child rapist and killer Mr Cruel |url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/victoria/net-closes-in-on-child-rapist-and-killer-mr-cruel/story-e6frf7kx-1225970520859?from=public_rss |newspaper=The Herald Sun |location=Melbourne, Victoria |publisher=News Limited |accessdate=2014-05-11}}</ref> If the perpetrator is still alive he would be between approximately 60 and 75 years old in 2014.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Roberts |first1=Greg |last2=Scott |first2=Edwina |date=2010-12-14 |title=New clues in police hunt for 'Mr Cruel' |url=http://news.theage.com.au/breaking-news-national/new-clues-in-police-hunt-for-mr-cruel-20101214-18vna.html |newspaper=The Age |location=Melbourne, Victoria |publisher=Fairfax |accessdate=2014-05-11}}</ref> The murder of Karmein Chan is still one of the extensive and expensive investigations in Victorian history, with a combination of investigative errors and the perpetrator's precautions preventing his identification and arrest.<ref>{{cite news |last=Moor |first=Keith |date=2012-04-10 |title=Mr Cruel was a meticulous, intelligent predator, say police |url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/law-order/mr-cruel-was-a-meticulous-intelligent-predator-say-police-investigators/story-fnat7jnn-1226320066350 |newspaper=The Herald Sun |location=Melbourne, Victoria |publisher=News Limited |accessdate=2014-05-11}}</ref> * [[Ioan P. Culianu]] (41), a [[Romanian American]] professor of religion at the [[University of Chicago]], was shot in the back of the head in a bathroom of the university's divinity school building on 21 May 1991. While rightist Romanian nationalists in the then-new Romanian government of [[Ion Iliescu]], some of whom openly celebrated his death, and members of the Communist-era ''[[Securitate]]'' intelligence service were suspected, along with occultists who also clashed with Culianu, no one has ever been formally identified as one.<ref name="Ioan Culianu">{{cite journal |last=Anton |first=Ted | date=September–October 1992 |title=The Killing Of Professor Culianu |url=http://linguafranca.mirror.theinfo.org/9209/culianu.html |journal=Lingua Franca|publisher= |volume=2 |issue=6 |pages= |doi= |accessdate=11 November 2014}}</ref> * A retired police officer accused of [[Father's Day Bank Massacre|killing four security guards]] in the course of stealing $200,000 from the United Bank Tower in downtown [[Denver, Colorado]], on 14 June 1991, was acquitted the following year. He died in 2013; the case remains open.<ref>Romero, John. [http://www.kdvr.com/news/kdvr-fathers-day-massacre-mystery-txt,0,2862251.story "19 years later, Denver bank massacre still a mystery"], {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110716234552/http://www.kdvr.com/news/kdvr-fathers-day-massacre-mystery-txt,0,2862251.story |date=2011-07-16 }} ''Fox 31: KDVR'', Denver, May 24, 2010.</ref> * The body of [[Robert Donati]] (51), a [[Boston metropolitan area|Boston-area]] mobster believed to have masterminded the [[Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum theft|theft of $500 million worth of art]] from the [[Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum]] the year before, was found beaten and stabbed multiple times in the trunk of his car on 24 September 1991, three days after he had last been seen alive leaving his nearby home in [[Revere, Massachusetts]]. He was likely a casualty of an ongoing war for control of the [[Patriarca crime family]], but no suspects have ever been charged with the crime.<ref name="Robert Donati">{{cite book|last=Boser|first=Ulrich|title=The Gardner Heist|page=142|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=xcWTIlR6NIQC|publisher=[[Harper Collins]]|isbn=9780061451843|date=2009|accessdate=September 19, 2016}}</ref> *[[:de:Heinz Bonn|Heinz Bonn]] (44), [[Association football|football]] player who played for [[Hamburger SV]] and is today considered the first German professional football player who was known to be [[Homosexuality|homosexual]], was found dead in his apartment in [[Hanover]] on 5 December 1991. The police suspected that he had been murdered by a [[Male prostitution|male prostitute]], but the murderer was never found out.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bild.de/sport/fussball/mord/nach-schuessen-auf-ex-st-pauli-star-denis-naki-7-fussball-stars-deren-tod-noch-immer-ungeklaert-ist-54407820.bild.html|title=Nach Schüssen auf Ex-St.-Pauli-Star Denis Naki - 7 Fußballer, deren Tode noch immer mysteriös sind|work=bild.de|access-date=2018-10-27|language=de}}</ref> * On 6 December 1991, police in [[Austin, Texas]], discovered [[1991 Austin yogurt shop murders|the bodies of four young women]], stripped, bound and shot in the head, after a nighttime fire at a yogurt shop. Eight years later, two suspects were convicted, but those convictions were overturned in 2009 and charges dismissed due to questions about the DNA evidence. No other suspects have ever been named although the investigation is continuing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kxan.com/dpp/news/crime/unit-works-to-solve-yogurt-shop-murders|title=Unit works to solve yogurt shop murders|date=December 6, 2011|work=kxan.com|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111208025100/http://www.kxan.com/dpp/news/crime/unit-works-to-solve-yogurt-shop-murders|archivedate=December 8, 2011|df=}}</ref> *[[Death of Katrien De Cuyper|Katrien De Cuyper]] (15), disappeared on her way home in [[Antwerp]], Belgium, on the night of 17 December 1991. Her body was found buried in the [[port of Antwerp]] six months later. In 1997, {{ill|Regina Louf|fr|Affaire du témoin X1}} confessed to killing De Cuyper while part of a "paedophile network", but no concrete evidence was found to support her testimony.<ref name=":1" /> In 2006, a 35-year-old man was arrested and charged with her kidnapping and murder after it was established that he had written anonymous letters about her to a magazine, but was later released due to a lack of evidence.<ref name=":3">{{Cite news|url=https://www.nieuwsblad.be/cnt/dmf19122006_058|title=Verdachte in zaak Katrien De Cuyper op vrije voeten|date=19 December 2006|work=[[Het Nieuwsblad]]|access-date=20 May 2018|language=nl-BE}}</ref> * Writer [[Joe Cole (writer)|Joe Cole]] (30), was shot and killed on 19 December 1991, during a robbery outside the [[Venice Beach, California]], home he shared with [[Black Flag (band)|Black Flag]] lead singer [[Henry Rollins]], who was present and escaped. No suspects have ever been identified.<ref name="Joe Cole">{{cite web|title=Dennis Cole, 'Felony Squad' Actor, Is Dead at 69|first=Dennis|last=Hevesi|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=November 23, 2009|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/11/22/arts/television/22cole.html|accessdate=August 24, 2015}}</ref> * A [[suicide bombing|suicide bomber]] drove a truck filled with explosives into [[1992 attack on Israeli embassy in Buenos Aires|the Israeli embassy in Argentina]] on 17 March 1992, killing 29 in the deadliest attack ever on an Israeli diplomatic mission. Argentinian officials said they strongly believed Iran was behind the attack. They have not formally prosecuted any suspects, though they suspected [[Imad Mughniyah]] was involved in both this attack and the deadlier [[AMIA bombing]] two years later. * Exiled Iranian dissident [[Fereydoun Farrokhzad]] (53), was found dead of multiple stab wounds in his house in [[Bonn]], Germany, on 13 August 1992. The autopsy established that he had been killed five days earlier. No one has ever been named as a suspect although it is widely believed that he was killed at the behest of the Iranian government.<ref name="voa">{{cite news |url=http://www.voanews.com/persian/news/a-31-2008-06-23-voa10-62465437.html |title=48 Hours remembered the great showman Fereydoun Farrokhzad |publisher= [[VOA News]] |date= June 23, 2008|accessdate= }}</ref> Prior to his murder, Farrokzhad had been involved in producing an opposition radio program and reportedly received death threats. In his show the [[Royal Albert Hall]] in [[London]] he had criticized [[Ruhollah Khomeini]] and made fun of Khomeini's obsession with sex in his ''Ressaleh'' book. He had consequently received death threats and there were concerns for his safety.<ref name="unhcr2">{{cite web|url=http://www.unhcr.org/refworld/country,,IRBC,COUNTRYREP,IRN,,3ae6a8170,0.html |title=Refworld. Chronology of Events: June 1989 -July 1994, (see: 3 August) |website=unhcr.org |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121010211832/http://www.unhcr.org/refworld/country,,IRBC,COUNTRYREP,IRN,,3ae6a8170,0.html |archivedate=2012-10-10 |df= }}</ref> * [[Piotr Jaroszewicz]] (82), a former Prime Minister of Communist Poland, was found murdered along with his wife Alicja Solska at their home in the [[Warsaw]] suburb of [[Anin]] on 3 September 1992. He had been strangled with a belt, which was still around his neck, after being beaten (and bandaged); she had been shot several times with one of the couple's hunting rifles after her hands were tied behind her back. She may have injured one of their attackers, who apparently also tried to kill the couple's dog with poison gas, while fighting back. A safe was left open and documents were taken from it while valuables were left behind. The killings were found to have occurred two days before; friends and family say that Jaroszewicz, who was obsessed with security to begin with, had been acting extremely paranoid in the days before the murders. No suspects have been named.<ref name="NYT Jaroszewicz death story">{{cite news|last=Engelberg|first=Stephen|title=Warsaw Journal; Strange, Brutal Murders, and Everyone's Baffled|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1992/11/14/world/warsaw-journal-strange-brutal-murders-and-everyone-s-baffled.html|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=November 14, 1992|accessdate=April 21, 2015}}</ref> * [[Alcasser Girls|The Alcasser Girls]], were three teenage girls from [[Alcàsser|Alcasser, Spain]], who disappeared on 13 November 1992,<ref name="ElPais071292">[http://elpais.com/diario/1992/12/07/opinion/723682806_850215.html ¡Antonia, Desirée, Miriam!], El País, 7 December 1992.</ref> and were found dead on 27 January 1993, and it was revealed that they had been [[kidnapping|kidnapped]], and raped, [[Battery (crime)|beaten]], [[torture]]d after they were abducted.<ref name="930128FB">[http://elpais.com/diario/1993/01/28/espana/728175620_850215.html Hallados los cadáveres de las tres niñas desaparecidas de Alcàsser con indicios de haber sido asesinadas], Francesc Bayarri, El País, 28 January 1993.</ref><ref name="930129JDFB">[http://elpais.com/diario/1993/01/29/espana/728262012_850215.html Tres detenidos por el asesinato de las niñas de Alcásser], Jesús Duva, Francesc Bayarri, El País, 29 January 1993.</ref> Their killers have never been found or identified. * Retired Canadian professional wrestler Adolfo Bresciano, 44, who performed under the name [[Dino Bravo]], was found dead of multiple gunshot wounds in his [[Laval, Quebec]] home on 10 March 1993. It is believed by law enforcement and those who knew him that he was killed by the Montreal Mafia over his successful cigarette smuggling business. Officially no suspects have ever been identified. * [[Colin Ridgway]] (56), the first Australian to play in the [[National Football League]], was murdered in his [[University Park, Texas]], home on 13 May 1993. Police suspect a man serving time in Florida for a 2011 murder committed the crime after being hired by Ridgway's wife and his father; however, they have not found sufficient evidence to arrest anyone.<ref name="Colin Ridgway">{{cite news|title=Law & Order: Man found dead in apartment complex pond|url=http://members.jacksonville.com/news/crime/2014-09-04/story/law-order-man-found-dead-apartment-complex-pond|newspaper=[[Florida Times-Union]]|date=September 4, 2014|accessdate=November 12, 2014}}</ref> * [[Brett Cantor]] (25), part-owner of the Dragonfly nightclub in [[Hollywood, Los Angeles|Hollywood]], was found stabbed to death in his nearby home on July 30, 1993;<ref name="Variety obit">{{cite news|title=A&R exec Cantor slain|url=https://variety.com/1993/biz/news/a-r-exec-cantor-slain-109236/|newspaper=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=August 3, 1993|accessdate=July 8, 2018}}</ref> no suspects have ever been identified.<ref>{{cite news|last=McRady|first=Rachel|title=Rose McGowan Tells All in New Memoir 'Brave': 14 Shocking Allegations|url=https://www.etonline.com/rose-mcgowan-tells-all-new-memoir-brave-14-shocking-allegations-95401|newspaper=[[Entertainment Tonight|ET Online]]|date=January 30, 2018|accessdate=July 9, 2018}}</ref> The case gained renewed attention a year later when [[O.J. Simpson]]'s defense team successfully petitioned the court trying him for the murders of [[Nicole Brown Simpson]], his ex-wife, and [[Ronald Goldman]], for access to the case file, on the grounds that the way in which all three were stabbed suggested the same killer.<ref>{{cite news|last=Noble|first=Kenneth|title=Simpson's Attempt to Bar Evidence Is Turned Down|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1994/09/22/us/simpson-s-attempt-to-bar-evidence-is-turned-down.html|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=September 22, 1994|accessdate=July 8, 2018}}</ref> Since Goldman had worked for Cantor as a waiter, and Nicole Simpson was a regular at Dragonfly, some books about the case have raised the possibility that the three killings may also have resulted from involvement in drug trafficking.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Bailey|first1=F. Lee|last2=Rabe|first2=Jean|authorlink1=F. Lee Bailey|title=When the Husband is the Suspect|date=2008|publisher=MacMillan|isbn=9780765316134|pages=103–04|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Ga7ksDpMH-wC&pg=PA103}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|last1=Bosco|first1=Joe|title=A Problem of Evidence: How the Prosecution Freed O.J. Simpson|date=1996|publisher=William Morrow|isbn=9780688144135|pages=94–96|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ds06AQAAIAAJ}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|last1=Freed|first1=Donald|last2=Briggs|first2=Raymond P.|authorlink1=Donald Freed|title=Killing Time: The First Full Investigation Into the Unsolved Murders of Nicole Brown Simpson and Ronald Goldman|date=1996|publisher=MacMillan|isbn=9780028613406|page=149|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=hKYuAQAAIAAJ}}</ref> * The body of [[Holly Piirainen]] (10), was found on 23 October 1993, in the woods of [[Brimfield, Massachusetts]]. She had disappeared in August while visiting her grandparents in nearby [[Sturbridge, Massachusetts|Sturbridge]]. Police have identified two [[persons of interest]], one of whom died in 2003, the other of whom has been named in connection with the [[Death of Molly Bish|Molly Bish murder]] which occurred several years later in the region. Neither has been named as a suspect in the case, however.<ref name="Holly Piirainen">{{cite news|title=Holly Piirainen: New details emerge in 19-year-old murder case|url=http://www.myfoxboston.com/story/20142417/2012/11/19/new-details-emerge-in-hunt-for-holly-piirainen|newspaper=[[WFXT]]|date=November 20, 2012|accessdate=November 11, 2014}}</ref> * [[Inokashira Park dismemberment incident]] in Japan, 23 April 1994.<ref>週刊朝日 ''未解決事件ファイル 真犯人に告ぐ''. Tokyo: 朝日新聞出版, 2010.</ref> * David Cullen Bain of [[Dunedin]], New Zealand, was initially convicted of the 20 June 1994 [[Bain family murders|murder of his parents and three siblings]] at their home. Prosecutors claimed he had staged the crime to look like his father had committed a [[murder-suicide]] of his family while David was out delivering papers; his defence claimed that murder-suicide was exactly what had happened. With help from former rugby star [[Joe Karam]], David pursued appeals and was eventually acquitted after a 2009 retrial. Other than David and his father, no other person was suspected.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.scoop.co.nz/stories/HL0705/S00225.htm|title=David Bain v The Queen (para 8)|last=|first=|date=11 May 2007|website=|publisher=Committee of the Privy Council|access-date=9 January 2017}}</ref> * The 18 July 1994 [[AMIA bombing|suicide bombing of a Jewish organization's building in Buenos Aires]] killed 85, surpassing the similar attack on the Israeli embassy two years earlier as Argentina's deadliest terror attack. Five suspects, four of whom were local police officers, were acquitted in a 2004 trial; the investigating judge was removed from the case and later impeached after it was disclosed that he had paid for evidence. British authorities arrested an Iranian suspect named by Argentina in 2003 but declined to extradite him due to weak evidence. No other suspects have been named although investigations continue, one of which has since led to the unsolved death of [[Alberto Nisman]], the investigating prosecutor. * The day after that bombing, another suicide bomber brought down [[Alas Chiricanas Flight 901|a plane in Panama]], killing 21, 12 of whom were Jews. While an apparently fictitious Arab terrorist organization claimed responsibility, no suspects have ever been identified. * Irish crime boss [[Martin Cahill|Martin "The General" Cahill]] (45), was shot and killed at a Dublin intersection on 18 August 1994. The [[Provisional Irish Republican Army|Provisional IRA]] claimed responsibility, citing Cahill's dealings with the [[Ulster Volunteer Force]]; however, it has also been reported that the IRA took exception to this only after being paid by two of Cahill's subordinates who were not eager to share profits from a drug operation with him. No arrests have ever been made. * [[Johan Heyns]] (66), an [[Afrikaner Calvinism|Afrikaner Calvinist]] [[theology|theologian]], was shot and killed from outside his house in [[Pretoria]], South Africa's capital, while playing cards with his wife and grandchildren on 5 November 1994. While no suspects have ever been identified, it is widely believed the killing was the work of radical white supremacists unhappy with Heyns' increasingly liberal political views, which in addition to opposition to [[apartheid]] had also called for tolerance of homosexuals. * [[Murder of Melanie Carpenter|Melanie Carpenter]] (23), Canadian woman who was abducted and murdered in [[Surrey, British Columbia]], on 6 January 1995. Carpenter was taken from her workplace and found dead in the Fraser Canyon several weeks later, and the prime suspect, Fernand Auger committed suicide before arrest. * [[Deanna Cremin]] (17), teenage girl from [[Somerville, Massachusetts]], United States, was murdered on March 30, 1995. Her body was found behind a senior housing complex. An autopsy revealed she had been strangled. She was last seen alive by her boyfriend who, unlike on other occasions when he would walk her to the door, walked her only halfway and she continued on her own toward her house. Her murder remains unsolved.<ref>{{cite news | first=Megan | last=Tench | title=A mother's renewed hope for justice | date=30 March 2005 | url =http://www.boston.com/news/local/articles/2005/03/30/a_mothers_renewed_hope_for_justice/ | work =Boston Globe | accessdate = 2008-10-06}}</ref> * [[Murder of Michael Nigg|Michael Nigg]] (26), an aspiring actor and waiter at a Los Angeles restaurant, was shot and killed during an attempted robbery on 8 September 1995 while withdrawing money from an ATM.<ref name="Michael Nigg death">{{cite news|title=Goldman Friend Slain Resisting Robbery|url=http://www.deseretnews.com/article/438329/GOLDMAN-FRIEND-IS-SLAIN-RESISTING-ROBBERY.html|newspaper=[[Associated Press]]|date=September 12, 1995|accessdate=August 23, 2015}}</ref> Three suspects were arrested a month later but released for lack of evidence and the case remains unsolved. Since Nigg was a friend of [[Ronald Goldman]], with whom he had worked, and seemed to live quite well for someone in his position, leading to some reports that he was involved in drug trafficking, his death has been used to support theories that [[O. J. Simpson murder case|the murders of Goldman and O.J. Simpson's ex-wife Nicole]] the year before were drug-related as well. * Mitchell Bates, a sleeping-car attendant for [[Amtrak]], was killed when the ''[[Sunset Limited]]'' [[1995 Palo Verde, Arizona derailment|derailed]] on 9 October 1995, near [[Palo Verde, Arizona]]. Investigators later found notes from a group identified as the "Sons of the Gestapo", supposedly angry over the [[Waco siege]] earlier that year. The tracks were found to have been tampered with in a way that circumvented safety warning systems, suggesting a perpetrator with knowledge of rail operations. No suspects have ever been identified, however, although the FBI believes the real plan was to rob a passing freight and there were no terrorist motivations. * Rapper Randy Walker, 27, better known as [[Stretch (rapper)|Stretch]], was shot and killed by the occupants of a vehicle passing his minivan in [[Queens Village]], New York, shortly after midnight on 30 November 1995. No suspects have ever been identified, but it is often believed to be somehow related to [[Tupac Shakur]]'s later death, since it took place exactly one year after [[Tupac Shakur#1994 Attack at Quad Recording Studios|an apparent robbery attempt]] in which Shakur had been seriously injured. * [[Jacksonville Jane Doe]], a body found on 6 December 1995. She is believed to have been murdered in the early 1990s and was then disposed of in Jacksonville, North Carolina. She has never been identified.<ref>{{cite web|title=Putting a face to a mystery eaturing Project EDAN|url=http://www.doenetwork.org/media/news29.html|accessdate=25 February 2014|author1=Mike Sherrill |author2=Kinea White |lastauthoramp=yes|year=2003}}</ref> * [[Amber Hagerman]] (10), victim of an abduction and murder on 13 January 1996, while riding her bike near her grandparents' home in [[Arlington, Texas]]. Four days later, a man walking his dog found her body in a creek bed. An autopsy revealed that her throat had been cut. Although a $75,000 reward was offered for information leading to Hagerman's killer, the perpetrator was never found. Her murder would later inspire the creation of the [[AMBER Alert]] system.<ref>{{cite news | title=About Amber Hagerman | date=3 December 2000 | url =http://www.amber-plan.net/about_amber.htm | work =Houston Regional Amber Plan | accessdate = 2008-10-06 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080224013415/http://www.amber-plan.net/about_amber.htm |archivedate = February 24, 2008}}</ref> * Sarah Keyenejad (19), who was six months pregnant, was shot to death at 12:48 a.m. 14 Feb 1996, when two black males dressed in women's clothing robbed the 7-Eleven at 3501 E. Bonanza Road, Las Vegas, Nevada. The bullet also struck and killed her unborn baby.<ref>https://www.lvmpd.com/en-us/Homicide/Pages/casesbyyear1990-1999.aspx</ref> * The body of [[Murder of Barbara Barnes|Barbara Barnes]] (13), from [[Steubenville, Ohio]], was found strangled on a riverbed on 22 February 1996, over two months after she was last seen walking to school. Some of her relatives have been suspected, but the case remains open.<ref name="Barbara Barnes">{{cite book|last=Swaint|first=Jack|title=Who killed--? Pittsburgh, PA|date=10 July 2007|publisher=Rooftop Pub.|location=Bloomington, IN|isbn=1600080405|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=c4pUohXVD9oC&pg=PA21&lpg=PA21&dq=barbara+barnes+murdered#v=onepage&q=barbara%20barnes%20murdered|accessdate=20 May 2014|chapter=Who Killed 13-Year-Old Barbara Ann Barnes?}}</ref> * On July 11, 1996, the half-naked body Canadian, [[Murder of Blair Adams|Blair Adams]] (31), was found in a parking lot in [[Knoxville, Tennessee]], scattered around his body was German, Canadian, and U.S. currency totaling nearly $4,000. Authorities believe he knew no one in Tennessee, and investigators retracing his steps found the way he arrived made as little sense as the way he died.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.knoxsheriff.org/coldcase/homicides.php|title=Cold Cases - Homicides - Knox County Tennessee Sheriff|website=www.knoxsheriff.org|access-date=2017-11-30}}</ref> * [[Tupac Shakur]], a top-selling American rapper who was shot four times in a drive-by shooting on 7 September 1996, in [[Las Vegas Valley|Las Vegas]], [[Nevada]], United States. He died six days later of respiratory failure and cardiac arrest at the [[University Medical Center of Southern Nevada|University Medical Center]].<ref>''Las Vegas Sun'', [http://www.lasvegassun.com/news/1996/sep/11/tupac-seen-in-fight-on-video/ "Tupac seen in fight on video,"] by [[Cathy Scott]], September 11, 1996</ref> * On the morning of 13 August 1996 Indonesian journalist [[Murder of Udin|Udin]] was beaten to death at his home with a metal rod by two men who gained entry by claiming they wanted to leave a motorcycle with him for safekeeping; they then fled on that motorcycle. The investigation became a political issue with opponents of the [[Suharto]] regime claiming the dictator himself or other government officials were behind it as retaliation for his reporting on their misdeeds, while the government and police suggested it had been the work of a jealous husband. A suspect arrested on the latter theory was later acquitted, protesting his innocence as his trial revealed that he had been pressured to confess and other investigative shortcomings. The police have declined to investigate the case further, saying their responsibility was fulfilled when they arrested the original suspect. * Nigerian businesswoman [[Bisoye Tejuoso]] (80), daughter of a former [[Egba people|Egba]] tribal chief, was assassinated on September 19, 1996, during a dispute over the tribe's [[Oba (ruler)|obaship]]. The killers have never been identified. * [[Sophie Toscan du Plantier]]. Wife of French filmmaker [[Daniel Toscan du Plantier]], found beaten to death outside her home in Toormore near [[Schull]] in County Cork, Ireland, on the morning of the 23 December 1996. Former French President [[Jacques Chirac]] was a friend of the couple and gave the case national attention. The main suspect, Ian Bailey, has been questioned twice by the Irish authorities in relation to the murder, but the DPP (Director of Public Prosecutions) decided not to prosecute. In early April 2010 the French authorities issued an arrest warrant for Mr. Bailey. Later that month the Gardaí in Ireland arrested Ian Bailey and brought him in front of the High Court in Dublin to appeal his extradition. This case is ongoing and is expected to take many months.<ref>{{cite news | first=Shane | last=Phelan | title=High-profile killing remains unsolved over a decade later | date=14 July 2008 | url =http://www.independent.ie/national-news/highprofile-killing-remains-unsolved-over-a-decade-later-1432461.html | work =Irish Independent | accessdate = 2008-10-06}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | first=James | last=Helm | title='Black cloud' of unsolved murder | date=19 January 2004 | url =http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/3411625.stm | work =BBC News | accessdate = 2008-10-06}}</ref> * [[JonBenét Ramsey]] (6), American girl who had competed in child beauty pageants, was found dead in the basement of her parents' home in [[Boulder, Colorado]], on 26 December 1996, nearly eight hours after a ransom note was apparently found and she was reported missing. The coroner listed cause of death as "[[asphyxia]] due to strangulation, associated with" a broken skull and concussion. Police suspected the parents of staging the ransom note and strangulation to cover up an accidental killing by either the mother or nine-year-old brother. A 1999 [[grand jury]] recommended charging the parents with obstruction and endangerment, but the district attorney declined to prosecute. Discovery of trace DNA from an unknown male in 2003<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2004/12/16/48hours/main661569.shtml |work=CBS News |title=JonBenet: DNA Rules Out Parents |date=December 16, 2004}}</ref> led a new district attorney in 2008 to write an apology to the Ramseys, declaring them "cleared of any involvement".<ref>{{ cite news | title =JonBenet Ramsey's Parents Cleared | work =ABC News | url = http://abcnews.go.com/video/playerIndex?id=5349856 | date = 2008-07-10 | accessdate = 2013-11-04 }}</ref> Contradictory evidence seems to support both the family and outside intruder theories, and after several independent investigations, the case is still unsolved {{As of|2016|09|lc=y}}.<ref>{{cite news | title = Murder of JonBenét Ramsey | publisher = Tru TV Crime Library | url = http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/notorious_murders/famous/ramsey/index_1b.html | accessdate = 2008-07-09}}</ref> * On 5 February 1997, [[Interstate 84 in New York#Incidents|Richard Aderson]] (47), a school administrator from [[LaGrange, New York]], had a minor collision with another driver just before crossing the [[Newburgh-Beacon Bridge]] along [[Interstate 84 in New York|Interstate 84]]. Across the river, just outside [[Fishkill (village), New York|Fishkill]], the two pulled over to exchange information. After they argued briefly, the other driver shot Aderson. He was able to describe the assailant and his vehicle before dying at the scene. A sketch has been circulated, but no suspect has ever been identified.<ref name="Richard Aderson">{{cite news |last=Lynch |first=Elizabeth |title=5 years after road rage killing on Interstate 84, mystery remains |url=http://www.poughkeepsiejournal.com/projects/crimebeat/po020402s1.shtml |newspaper=[[Poughkeepsie Journal]] |date=February 4, 2002 |accessdate=February 19, 2015}}</ref> * [[Ali Forney]] (22), an advocate for homeless LGBT youth in the New York neighborhood of [[Harlem]], was found shot dead on a street there on 5 February 1997. The case remains unsolved. * [[The Notorious B.I.G.]], an American rapper killed by an unknown assailant in a drive-by shooting on 9 March 1997, in [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles, California]], United States. Even though a [[Facial composite|composite sketch]]<ref>{{cite web|last=Lait|first=Matt |last2=Glover|first2=Scott|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20010417092049/http://www.latimes.com/news/state/updates/lat_corrupt991209.htm|url=http://www.latimes.com/news/state/updates/lat_corrupt991209.htm|title=Ex-LAPD Officer Is Suspect in Rapper's Slaying, Records Show|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=1999-12-09|accessdate=2007-01-01|archivedate=2001-04-17}}</ref> of the perpetrator was made, the case is still unsolved. *On 8 April 1997 a [[Turks in Germany|Turkish German]] male [[Murder of Adem Bozkurt|Adem Bozkurt]] (45), was found dead in his car that apparently had crashed into a tree by a road near [[Bad Nauheim]]. The case was ruled an accident, any involvement of other parties was ruled out and Bozkurt was buried without an autopsy. However, 21 years later, after doing some tests, questioning some witnesses and finally exhuming the body and doing an autopsy on it, the police found out that Bozkurt had been shot in the neck. Investigations were resumed, but so far no definite suspect has been identified.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.hessenschau.de/panorama/autounfall-stellt-sich-nach-21-jahren-als-mord-heraus,fall-bozkurt-100.html|title=Autounfall stellt sich nach 21 Jahren als Mord heraus|last=Germany|first=hessenschau.de, Frankfurt,|date=2018-07-19|work=hessenschau.de|access-date=2018-07-26|language=de-DE}}</ref> * Bones found on a hillside by hunters in [[Pisgah National Forest]] near [[Asheville, North Carolina]], on 7 September 1997 were later identified as those of [[Judy Smith homicide|Judy Smith]] (50), a nurse from [[Newton, Massachusetts]], who had last been seen five months earlier at a [[Philadelphia]] hotel where she was accompanying her husband at a legal conference. Cutting marks on the bones, along with slash and puncture marks on a bra found near the body, led investigators to conclude she had been stabbed to death. The case remains open.<ref name="Judy Smith">{{cite news|last=O'Neill|first=Marnie|title=Boston nurse vanished in Philadelphia, found dead in North Carolina|url=http://www.news.com.au/world/north-america/the-strange-unsolved-case-of-judy-smith/news-story/b17a4452389568a863596acbe1c49364|newspaper=[[News.com.au]]|date=May 14, 2016|accessdate=September 3, 2017}}</ref> * [[Jane Thurgood-Dove]] (35), was shot outside her car, in full view of her young children, as she pulled into the driveway of her home in the Melbourne suburb of [[Niddrie, Victoria|Niddrie]] on 6 November 1997; the killer escaped into a waiting getaway car which was found, burnt, shortly afterwards not too far away.<ref name="Herald Sun 2012 Thurgood-Dove story">{{cite news|last=Buttler|first=Mark|title=Jane Thurgood-Dove's murder was a senseless crime we'll never forget|url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/law-order/jane-thurgood-doves-murder-was-a-senseless-crime-well-never-forget/story-fnat7jnn-1226509905618|newspaper=[[Herald Sun]]|date=November 4, 2012|accessdate=January 27, 2015}}</ref> Her husband and a police official believed to have been infatuated with her have been eliminated as suspects. More recently a theory has been floated that the killers were members of a local biker gang who had mistaken her for their real target, another local woman of similar appearance married to a fellow criminal. Police believe that the shooter and getaway car driver have since died of a heart attack and boating accident respectively; they have offered the remaining participant immunity if he testifies against the man who they believe ordered the killing.<ref name="Herald Sun 2012 Thurgood-Dove immunity story">{{cite news|last=Buttler|first=Mark|title=Police offer deal to former bikie over murder of Jane Thurgood-Dove|url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/law-order/police-offer-deal-to-former-bikie-over-murder-of-jane-thurgood-dove/story-fnat79vb-1226509900314?nk=ec8ce1c451dc9be6544f6dc08ff53b10|newspaper=[[Herald Sun]]|date=November 4, 2012|accessdate=January 27, 2015|subscription=yes}}</ref> * On 1 January 1998, the body of Australian 14-month-old [[Murder of Jaidyn Leskie|Jaidyn Leskie]] was found in a lake far from his home. He had been kidnapped the previous June. Greg Domaszczewicz, acquitted of the murder charge after a 1998 trial, was nevertheless found by a 2006 inquest to have had at least a contributing role in the crime, including the disposal of the body. However, current [[double jeopardy]] laws in [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] do not allow the state to try him again, and the case is still officially unsolved. * Australian organized-crime boss [[Alphonse Gangitano]] (40), the "Black Prince of [[Lygon Street]]", was found in his home dead from gunshot wounds shortly before midnight 16 January 1998, the first of the [[Melbourne gangland killings]]. [[Graham Kinniburgh]] and Jason Moran, both of whom were believed to have been in Gangitano's home that night, were suspected. They were both murdered later themselves. No arrests have been made. * [[Murder of Stephanie Crowe|Stephanie Crowe]] (12), was found stabbed to death in her [[Escondido, California]] bedroom on the morning of January 21, 1998. Since there were no signs of forced entry, police focused on and eventually arrested her older brother Michael and two friends; however, charges against them were abruptly dismissed when later lab tests found several drops of Crowe's blood on a local transient. He was tried and convicted, but that was overturned on appeal and a 2013 retrial acquitted him. The Crowe family reached a legal settlement with [[San Diego County, California|San Diego County]] over the wrongful prosecution of their son. No other suspects have been named.<ref name="Stephanie Crowe">{{cite news|url=http://www.kpbs.org/news/2013/dec/06/verdict-reached-richard-tuite-trial/|title=San Diego Jury Finds Richard Tuite Not Guilty In Retrial For The Murder Of Stephanie Crowe|last=Sauer|first=Mark|date=December 6, 2013|work=KPBS|accessdate=August 24, 2015}}</ref> * [[Murder of Alfred Kunz|Father Alfred Kunz]] (56), a Roman Catholic priest, was found with his throat cut on 4 March 1998, in his [[Dane, Wisconsin]], church. A wide pool of initial suspects was narrowed to one unnamed individual by 2009, whom police say they still track in the hope that eventually they will have enough evidence to arrest.<ref name=mjs>{{cite journal | title = Four Years After Killing of Priest, New Clues Few | journal = Milwaukee Journal Sentinel | date = 5 March 2002}} [https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=NbIaAAAAIBAJ&sjid=zz4EAAAAIBAJ&pg=5335,4171377&dq=alfred-kunz (available at Google news)]</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Officials:Slain priest had relationships with women |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=yglaAAAAIBAJ&sjid=LEsNAAAAIBAJ&pg=6437,339986&dq=alfred-kunz+dane |newspaper=The Telegraph-Herald |date=March 3, 2000 |accessdate=August 23, 2011}}</ref> * On 25 March 1998, [[NASCAR]] driver [[Chris Trickle]] (24), died of injuries sustained in a [[Las Vegas]] [[drive-by shooting]] on 9 February 1997. A quirk in Nevada law at the time meant that the gunmen could not be prosecuted for his murder, since his death had occurred more than a year and a day after the attack; it was subsequently changed. No suspects have ever been identified, and the case is considered cold.<ref name="Chris Trickle">{{cite web|url=http://www.lasvegasweekly.com/news/archive/2008/feb/28/a-checkered-saga/|title=A Checkered Saga|last=Katsilometes|first=John|date=February 28, 2008|work=[[Las Vegas Weekly]]|accessdate=November 12, 2014|location=Las Vegas, NV}}</ref> *13-year old {{ill|Tristan Brübach|de|Mordfall Tristan}} was last seen alive at [[Frankfurt Höchst station|Frankfurt Höchst railway station]] on 26 March 1998 at 3:20 PM. Later that afternoon, his dead body was found near the railway station. He had been knocked unconscious and choked, and parts of his body had been cut out. The cause of death was a cut in the throat. The murderer was never identified.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/tristan-bruebach-20-jahre-spaeter-kommissar-uwe-fey-gibt-nicht-auf-a-1199037.html|title=Fall Tristan Brübach: Kommissar Fey und das Rätsel vom Liederbach-Tunnel|last=Jüttner|first=Julia|date=2018-03-24|work=Spiegel Online|access-date=2018-07-08|last2=Main|first2=Frankfurt am}}</ref> * [[Marek Papała]] (38), former Chief of Polish State Police, was shot in the head on 25 June 1998 while parking his car. In 2012, a former [[Motor vehicle theft|car thief]] turned state witness given immunity of prosecution came forward with the revelation that he had killed Papała. He also testified some Polish mafia bosses had encouraged the crime. However, in 2013 the indictment against the mafia bosses was dropped due to numerous factual and logical inconsistencies. The murder of Papała remains unsolved. * [[Ita Martadinata Haryono]], an Indonesian human rights activist, found dead on 9 October 1998 in her bedroom in Central [[Jakarta]], [[Indonesia]]. She had been stabbed ten times and her neck had been slashed. The murder occurred three days after a Jakarta press conference held by the human rights organizations she had been involved with.<ref>{{cite news | title=Counselor of rape victims killed in Indonesia | date=10 October 1998 | url =http://edition.cnn.com/WORLD/asiapcf/9810/10/indonesia.rape/ | work =CNN | accessdate = 2008-10-07|archiveurl=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P1-19486435.html|archivedate=2009|author=Thomas Wagner|via=HighBeam Research}}</ref> *[[Murder of Miranda Fenner|Miranda Fenner]], an 18-year-old employee at a video store in [[Laurel, Montana]], was brutally stabbed to death by an unknown assailant while working on the evening of November 15, 1998.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://billingsgazette.com/news/local/crime-and-courts/fenner-murder-case-getting-new-attention/article_ef63c8ac-cbed-5ddf-8316-b628466399b9.html|work=The Billings Gazette|title=Fenner murder case getting new attention|author=Benoit, Zach|date=September 5, 2012|accessdate=September 13, 2016}}</ref> * [[Murder of Suzanne Jovin|Suzanne Jovin]] (21), a senior at [[Yale University]], was found stabbed to death on 4 December 1998 on campus.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Cochran|first1=Lee|title=New Clues in Yale Student Murder|url=http://abcnews.go.com/TheLaw/story?id=5300434&page=1|work=ABC|date=July 3, 2008}}</ref> Allegations that her thesis advisor was a suspect led to the end of his career at Yale, but the crime remains unsolved. *[[Bindy Johal]] (27), a gangster a self-confessed drug trafficker, who was raised in, and operated in, [[British Columbia]], Canada who on 20 December 1998, was killed from behind at a crowded nightclub in [[Vancouver|Vancouver, British Columbia]], by a person whose identity was and remains unknown.<ref name="Schneider p. 480">{{cite book|author=Stephen Schneider|title=Iced: The Story of Organized Crime in Canada|date= December 9, 2009|publisher=John Wiley & Sons|isbn=978-0-470-83500-5|page=[https://books.google.com/books?id=ZO8jKSn25DAC&pg=PA480 480]}}<!--|accessdate=June 16, 2013--></ref><ref name="Langton p. 59">{{cite book|author=Jerry Langton|title=The Notorious Bacon Brothers: Inside Gang Warfare on Vancouver Streets|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=8ISWelHjVWMC&pg=PT62|accessdate=June 16, 2013|date=January 25, 2013|publisher=John Wiley & Sons|isbn=978-1-118-40457-7|page=59}}</ref> *[[Kirsty Bentley]] (15), a teenage girl from [[Ashburton, New Zealand]], went missing while walking her family dog in the afternoon on 31 December 1998, after an extensive search lasting several weeks, her [[cadaver|body]] was found in dense [[scrubland|scrub]] approximately 40 km away.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.stuff.co.nz/national/crime/104330963/work-and-income-double-murderer-interviewed-over-kirsty-bentley-cold-case.html|title=Work and Income double murderer interviewed over Kirsty Bentley cold case|website=Stuff|language=en|access-date=29 October 2018}}</ref> [[New Zealand Police|Police]] consider the case to be a [[homicide]], and it remains one of the highest-profile [[cold case|unsolved murders]] in New Zealand. Her killer has never been identified. * A badly mutilated body found deep in a [[New South Wales]] state forest in January 1999 was identified as [[Lois Roberts]] (38), of [[Lismore, New South Wales|Lismore]], who had not been seen since leaving the police station in [[Nimbin, New South Wales|Nimbin]] the previous 31 July. The case remains open. * [[Big L]], a Harlem rapper, was shot multiple times in the head and chest near his Harlem home on 15 February 1999.<ref name="MTV death">{{Cite web | url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1425010/fat-joe-associate-big-l-dead-at-22.jhtml | title=Fat Joe Associate Big L Dead at 22 | work=''[[MTV.com]]'' | publisher=[[MTV Networks]] |accessdate=27 November 2014| date=February 17, 1999}}</ref> * The body of [[Immigration and Naturalization Service]] attorney [[Joyce Chiang]] (28), was found in the [[Potomac River]] in April 1999 by a canoeist, three months after she had last been seen. Washington police, who had initially called the case a suicide, later changed their minds and said it was a homicide. They have suspects, who are currently in prison, but have not publicly identified them.<ref name=NBC4May2011>{{cite news |title=Serial Rapists Killed Joyce Chiang: John Walsh|author= Gilchrist, Aaron |url= http://www.nbcwashington.com/news/local/Joyce-Chiang-Didnt-Kill-Herself-John-Walsh-121794869.html|newspaper= NBC4 Washington |date= May 13, 2011 |accessdate=27 November 2014}}</ref> * [[Jill Dando]], an English journalist and television presenter who worked for the BBC for 14 years. She was killed by a single gunshot wound to the head on 26 April 1999, after leaving the home of her fiancé. Her death sparked "Operation Oxborough", the biggest murder inquiry and largest criminal investigation since the hunt for the [[Yorkshire Ripper]].<ref>{{cite news | title=A meticulous investigation | date=2 July 2001 | url =http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/1409999.stm | work =BBC News | accessdate = 2008-10-07}}</ref> * On 12 June 1999, exactly seven months after her disappearance, the body of [[Christina Marie Williams]] (13), was found on the former [[Fort Ord]] Army base next to California's [[Monterey Bay]]. Police suspect a man in prison for other abductions; in 2011 a woman recanted her corroboration of his 1998 alibi in the case, saying she had been threatened into making it. However, no charges have been filed. * [[Ricky McCormick murder notes|Ricky McCormick]], whose body was found in a field by sheriff's officers in St. Charles County, Missouri, on June 30, 1999. The only clues to the mystery are two notes in his pockets, apparently written in a complex cipher.<ref>{{cite news | journal=[[Daily Telegraph]] | url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/crime/8432893/Calling-all-codebreakers....html | date=April 7, 2011 |accessdate=27 November 2014| title=Calling all codebreakers... | author=Tweedie, Neil }}</ref> * On 21 July 1999, the unidentified [[Racine County Jane Doe]] was found murdered. She was tortured for several weeks before her body was found in Raymond, Wisconsin.<ref name=wisn>{{cite news|last=Anderson|first=Mike|title=Investigators still believe Racine County Jane Doe case can be solved|url=http://www.wisn.com/news/south-east-wisconsin/racine-kenosha/investigtors-still-believe-racine-county-jane-doe-case-can-be-solved/22494034|accessdate=April 16, 2014|newspaper=WISN|date=October 17, 2013}}</ref> * [[Murder of Raonaid Murray|Raonaid Murray]], an [[Irish people|Irish]] (17) a youth who was stabbed to death at the within a few hundred metres of her home in [[Glenageary]], [[Co. Dublin]], in the early hours of Saturday morning, 4 September 1999.<ref name="FARAH 'DID NOT' MURDER RAONAID">{{cite web|author=[[Paul Williams (Irish journalist)|Paul Williams]] |url=http://www.sundayworld.com/columnists/index.php?aid=2603 |title=FARAH 'DID NOT' MURDER RAONAID |accessdate=27 November 2014 |publisher=[[Sunday World]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120220082108/http://www.sundayworld.com/columnists/index.php?aid=2603 |archivedate=20 February 2012 |df= }}</ref> * On 2 September 1999, a 55-gallon drum in the basement of a house in [[Nassau County, New York]] turned out to contain the pregnant body of [[Murder of Reyna Marroquin|Reyna Marroquin]], a [[El Salvador|Salvadoran]] immigrant murdered 30 years earlier. Police suspected a former owner of the house who had also run a dye company that used the drum. He had reportedly been having an affair with Marroquin. The day after police interviewed him in Florida and told him they would get a court order to produce a DNA sample, he killed himself. DNA tests later showed he had fathered the fetus. Police consider him their main suspect, but as he is dead himself he cannot be charged and the case remains officially open. * On 28 December 1999, a friend visiting the apartment of [[Larry Dale Lee]] (41), an American journalist in [[Guatemala City]], found his body with multiple stab wounds. It was determined that he had been killed two days earlier, shortly after he was last seen alive. Police developed several theories of the crime but no arrests have ever been made.
===2000s=== * [[Mark Moran (criminal)|Mark Moran]] (35), of Australia's [[Moran family|Moran crime family]], was shot and killed outside his [[Aberfeldie, Victoria|Aberfeldie]] home on the evening of June 15, 2000, another of the many still-unsolved [[Melbourne gangland killings]]. [[Carl Williams (criminal)|Carl Williams]], who was beaten to death by a fellow prison inmate a decade later, is the prime suspect. * An 17 August 2000, [[2000 department store "Centrs" bombing|bombing]] at the Centrs shopping mall in [[Riga]], the capital of [[Latvia]], killed one person. A suspect arrested and tried for planting one of the bombs was acquitted a year later by the country's Supreme Court; no one else has ever been identified. * [[Ulster loyalism|Loyalist]] paramilitary [[Jackie Coulter (loyalist)|Jackie Coulter]] (46), was shot and killed 21 August 2000, along with Bobby Mahood, a former member of the [[Ulster Volunteer Force]], while sitting in a parked car along Crumlin Road in [[Belfast]], Northern Ireland. While the [[Progressive Unionist Party]] later admitted that the UVF, its military wing, had carried out the killings in reprisal for an attack on it by members of Coulter's rival [[Ulster Defence Association]], no suspects have ever been named. It is believed the real target may have been [[Jackie Mahood|Mahood's brother, Jackie]], whom the killers may have mistaken him for; Coulter and Bobby Mahood were reportedly trying to broker an end to [[Loyalist feud#2000|Loyalist feud]] that claimed both their lives. * Former Indiana state trooper [[David Camm]] was convicted of the 28 September 2000, murder of his wife and children in their home while he was out playing basketball. After extensive evidence tampering and other investigative misconduct was uncovered, he was retried and acquitted. Camm's lawyers identified a career criminal who left forensic evidence at the scene and had committed similar crimes in the past as the more likely suspect, but he has not been prosecuted. * [[Setagaya family murder|A Japanese family of four was found murdered]] in their Tokyo home on 31 December 2000. Police were able to find a considerable amount of forensic evidence, including undigested food in excrement, that would help identify the suspect but no arrests have been made. * [[Murder of Jill-Lyn Euto|Jill-Lyn Euto]] (18), a student, was found stabbed to death in her sixth-floor apartment at 600 James St, [[Syracuse, NY]] on January 28, 2001. No arrests have been made.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amw.com/fugitives/case.cfm?id=25370#case |title=A Missed Meeting |publisher=America's Most Wanted |date=3 March 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110522055241/http://www.amw.com/fugitives/case.cfm?id=25370 |archivedate=22 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> * The 4 May 2001, gunshot murder of [[Bonnie Lee Bakley]], while she waited in a car for her husband actor [[Robert Blake (actor)|Robert Blake]] in [[Studio City, California|Studio City]], remains officially unsolved. He was tried and acquitted, but later held liable in a civil suit brought by Bakley's family.<ref>{{cite book|author = Miles Corwin|title = Homicide Special|year = 2003}}</ref> * [[Henryk Siwiak homicide|Henryk Siwiak]], (46), a Polish immigrant to New York City, was shot and killed on a [[Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn|Bedford-Stuyvesant]] street known for its heavy drug activity on the night of 11 September 2001. He is officially the only homicide victim in the city on that day since the victims of [[September 11 attacks|the terrorist attacks]] are not included in crime statistics. The diversion of police resources in the aftermath of the attacks constrained the investigation; no suspects have ever been identified.<ref name="Henryk Siwiak">{{cite news|last=Kern-Jedrychowska|first=Ewa|title=Revisiting the City's Lone And Unsolved Homicide on 9/11|url=http://www.wnyc.org/story/156998-homicide/|newspaper=[[WNYC]]|date=September 7, 2011|accessdate=September 6, 2011}}</ref> * [[Thomas C. Wales]] (born 1952) was an American federal prosecutor and gun control advocate. On 11 October 2001, he was killed by a bullet fired through the window of his basement home-office in Seattle, Washington. No suspects have been charged, and the investigation continues.<ref>[http://www.cephasministry.com/nwo_gun_control_advocate_shot.html Federal Prosecutor and Advocate of Gun Control Is Shot to Death] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060515155628/http://www.cephasministry.com/nwo_gun_control_advocate_shot.html |date=2006-05-15 }} October 2001</ref> * Five people died as a result of the [[2001 anthrax attacks]] in autumn of that year; however, no one has ever been arrested in the case. Biowarfare researcher [[Bruce Edwards Ivins]] killed himself in 2008 just before he was supposedly to be charged; he was the FBI's prime suspect. Others, including some of the targets of the attacks, have disputed that conclusion or believed he may not have been acting alone. * Kent Heitholt, 48, sports editor of Missouri's ''[[Columbia Daily Tribune]]'', was found beaten and strangled in his car at the newspaper's parking lot early on 1 November 2001. [[Ryan W. Ferguson]] was convicted of the murder in 2005 despite strongly protesting his innocence; eight years later he was released after the two key witnesses against him said they had been pressured to lie on the stand. No other suspects have been named in the case. * [[Nigerian Federal Ministry of Justice|Nigerian Minister of Justice]] [[Bola Ige]] (71), was shot and killed in his [[Ibadan]] home on December 23, 2001. Several suspects have been tried in the case; all were acquitted. No other suspects have been identified. * The body of [[Chandra Levy]] (24), an [[internship|intern]] at the [[U.S. Bureau of Prisons]], was found in [[Washington, D.C.|Washington]]'s [[Rock Creek Park]] on 22 May 2002, slightly over a year after she had been reported missing; her death was ruled a homicide although the medical examiner could not identify the exact means. Since investigations had revealed she and California congressman [[Gary Condit]] were having an affair, speculation at first had focused on him as a possible killer but police later cleared him; he was defeated for renomination in a [[primary election]] the next year with his behavior in the case cited as a contributing factor. In 2009, a [[El Salvador|Salvadorean]] [[illegal immigrant]], [[Ingmar Guandique]], was arrested and charged with the murder on the theory that he had bound Levy and left her to die there. His conviction at trial the next year was overturned on appeal in 2012 due to questions about tainted evidence from a jailhouse informant; a new trial at which the defense planned to introduce new evidence was ordered for 2015. Before it could take place, in July 2016, prosecutors dropped the charges against Guandique, saying they no longer believed they could prove their case, and instead began proceedings to have him [[deportation|deported]]. No other suspects have ever been named.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/07/28/us/charges-dropped-in-chandra-levy-murder/index.html|title=Charges dropped in Chandra Levy murder|last=CNN|first=Ralph Ellis and Cheri Mossburg|date=|website=CNN|publisher=|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160728230411/http://www.cnn.com/2016/07/28/us/charges-dropped-in-chandra-levy-murder/index.html|archive-date=2016-07-28|access-date=2016-07-28}}</ref> * [[MOVE#2002 murder of John Gilbride|John Gilbride]] (34), a baggage handler for US Airways at Philadelphia airport, was shot dead in his car outside his home in [[Maple Shade, New Jersey]] on 10 September 2002. He was involved in a custody dispute with his former wife, the widow of the founder of the radical group [[MOVE]], and was worried that members of the group might carry out threats they had made to kill him. While other former members of MOVE believe the group is responsible, and current members assert in turn that the murder was either faked or that the government did it in an attempt to frame them, it has also been suggested that gambling debts were involved. No suspects have been identified.<ref name="John Gilbride">{{cite news|last=Gale |first=Daryl |title=Who Shot John? |url=http://citypaper.net/articles/2003-06-19/cb.shtml |newspaper=[[Philadelphia City Paper]] |date=June 19, 2003 |accessdate=November 11, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151001170900/http://citypaper.net/articles/2003-06-19/cb.shtml |archivedate=October 1, 2015 |df= }}</ref> * [[Jennifer Servo]] (22), a TV news reporter, was found beaten and strangled in her [[Abilene, Texas]], apartment on 16 September 2002. Police have suspected either her former boyfriend or a coworker she had begun a new relationship with, but so far lack the evidence to arrest either.<ref name="Jennifer Servo">{{cite news|last=Dow|first=Harold|title=Deadline for Justice|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/deadline-for-justice/|newspaper=[[CBS News]]|date=April 19, 2008|accessdate=November 12, 2014}}</ref> * On 30 October 2002, two gunmen went into a [[Queens, New York]], recording studio and shot Jason Mizell, 37, better known as [[Jam Master Jay]], a founding member of pioneering [[hip hop]] group [[Run-DMC]], in the head at point-blank range; he died shortly thereafter.<ref name="Jam Master Jay">{{cite news|title=Run-DMC DJ slain in recording studio|url=http://www.cnn.com/2002/US/Northeast/10/31/run.dmc.killing/index.html|newspaper=[[CNN]]|date=October 31, 2002|accessdate=April 27, 2015}}</ref> While some suspects have been identified in the years since, no one has ever been prosecuted. * Bulgarian-born Australian mobster [[Nik Radev]] (44), was shot fatally as he got out of his car 15 April 2003, in the [[Melbourne, Australia|Melbourne]] suburb of [[Coburg, Victoria|Coburg]]. Like many other [[Melbourne gangland killings]], police believe it was related to his criminal activities, and suspect a rival drug dealer, but have not made any arrests. * The body of [[Death of Molly Bish|Molly Bish]] (16), of [[Warren, Massachusetts]], was found in woods near neighboring [[Palmer, Massachusetts|Palmer]] on 9 June 2003, almost three years after she was last seen by her mother when she dropped her off at her lifeguarding job. Several suspects have been investigated, but no arrests have been made.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.telegram.com/article/20111118/NEWS/111189803/0|title=A break in unsolved Bish, Piirainen slayings?|publisher=|accessdate=27 November 2014}}</ref> * South African memoirist and socialite [[Hazel Crane]] (52), a close friend of [[Winnie Mandela]], was shot and killed on 10 November 2003, in her car while traveling to [[Johannesburg]], where she was expected to testify in the trial of an Israeli man accused of killing her husband. She was the third witness in that trial to be killed; the case remains unsolved. * Retired [[Major League Baseball]] outfielder [[Iván Calderón (baseball)|Iván Calderón]] (41), was shot in the back several times outside a bar in his native [[Puerto Rico]] on 27 December 2003. No suspects have ever been identified. * [[John Whitehead (singer)|John Whitehead]] (55), half of the [[McFadden & Whitehead]] songwriting team, was shot fatally while fixing a car outside his Philadelphia home on 11 May 2004. It may have been a case of mistaken identity; however, no suspects have been named. * [[2004 Jenner, California double-murder|Lindsay Cutshall (22), and her fiancé Jason S. Allen (26)]], both counselors at a nearby Christian summer camp, were found shot dead on a public beach near [[Jenner, California]], on 18 August 2004. The autopsy established that they had died around three days earlier. Two possible suspects have been named; one is in prison for another murder committed around the same time and the other died in 2009. The investigation continues.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://jason-lindsay.blogspot.com/2004_09_01_archive.html|title=In Memory of Jason & Lindsay...: September 2004|work=jason-lindsay.blogspot.com}}</ref> * The body of a 2-year-old boy found wrapped in a blanket off an interstate highway near Naperville in [[DuPage County, Illinois]], on 8 October 2005, was identified six years later as [[Murder of Atcel Olmedo|Atcel Olmedo]]. The exact cause of death was impossible to determine due to the condition of his remains, but it appeared he had been severely beaten. His mother and stepfather are considered possible suspects; they are believed to have returned to Mexico. * The [[Jeff Davis 8]]: Eight women, all involved in prostitution and/or drugs, were found dead in [[Jefferson Davis Parish, Louisiana]], between 2005 and 2009. Investigators initially believed they were murdered by a serial killer, but reporting by [[Ethan Brown]] has suggested instead that there are multiple suspects, and local law enforcement personnel may be complicit.<ref name=NYT>{{cite web|last=Robertson|first=Campbell|title=8 Deaths in a Small Town, and Much Unease |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/01/02/us/02serial.html |publisher=New York Times |accessdate=27 November 2014}}</ref> * South African businessman [[Brett Kebble]] (41), was fatally shot in his car on 27 September 2005 while driving along Johannesburg's [[M1 (Johannesburg)|M1]] motorway to a dinner engagement. The bullets used were a special low-powered type normally used by bodyguards and security personnel to reduce the likelihood of injuries to people other than those targeted. Another South African businessman, [[Glenn Agliotti]], was charged with the crime a year later but acquitted in 2010 when the court hearing the case ruled that the state had not presented a case against him strong enough to require trial. No other suspects have ever been named. * [[Mario Condello]] (53), a member of the Australian Mafia, was fatally shot in the driveway of his [[Brighton, Victoria|Brighton]] home on 6 February 2006, the day before he was to stand trial for plotting to murder another mob boss, [[Carl Williams (criminal)|Carl Williams]].<ref name="Mario Condello">{{cite news|last1=Silvester|first1=John|last2=Evans|first2=Chris|title=Condello gunned down in Brighton|url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/national/condello-gunned-down/2006/02/06/1139074172355.html|newspaper=[[The Age]]|date=7 February 2006|accessdate=6 January 2015}}</ref> While Williams would later be convicted of in turn conspiring to have Condello murdered, and police believe the killer was a hit man currently in prison for another killing, the murder officially remains unsolved. * [[Murder of Robert Eric Wone|Robert Wone]] (32), was murdered on 2 August 2006, in his friend's Washington, D.C., apartment. He was "restrained, incapacitated, and sexually assaulted" prior to his death. The only individuals present in the apartment at the time were its three residents, all friends of Wone. They have denied involvement and insisted that an intruder committed the crime. Authorities claim that there was no evidence of a break-in: the apartment appeared to be washed and cleaned, the three residents appeared freshly showered, and the evidence was not consistent with the residents' accounts. In addition, the residents tampered with the crime scene, waited an inordinate amount of time to call 911, and exhibited strange behavior when paramedics and police arrived. Authorities believe that either some or all of the three house-mates murdered Wone and engaged in a cover-up.<ref>{{cite news|url= https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/05/31/AR2009053102510.html|title= The Robert Wone Stabbing: Anatomy of a Murder Case Part 1 | work=The Washington Post | first=Paul | last=Duggan | date=1 June 2009 | accessdate=11 May 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url= https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/06/01/AR2009060103472_5.html|title= The Robert Wone Stabbing: Anatomy of a Murder Case Part 2 | work=The Washington Post | first=Paul | last=Duggan | date=2 June 2009 | accessdate=11 May 2010}}</ref> * The unidentified body of [[Lavender Doe]] was found on 6 October 2006 in Kilgore, Texas. She died shortly before she was found, but was not recognizable because her body had been badly burned.<ref>{{cite web|title=Jane Doe 2006|url=http://www.missingkids.com/poster/NCMU/1137967/1#poster|website=missingkids.com|publisher=[[National Center for Missing and Exploited Children]]|accessdate=31 July 2014}}</ref> * [[Bryan Pata]] (22), a defensive lineman for the [[University of Miami]] [[Miami Hurricanes football|football team]], was shot dead outside his apartment on 7 November 2006. No suspects have been identified.<ref name="post">{{cite news|first=Amy|last=Shipley|title=Miami Player Dies After Shooting|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2006/11/07/AR2006110701535.html|work=The Washington Post|date=2006-07-08|accessdate=27 November 2014}}</ref> * [[Helen Hill]] (36), animator, was shot fatally during an attempted robbery of her home in the [[Faubourg Marigny]] section of [[New Orleans]] on 4 January 2007. Her death was one of six murders in the city that day, which inspired a protest march demanding a safer city in the wake of [[Effects of Hurricane Katrina in New Orleans|the disruptions caused by Hurricane Katrina]]. No suspect has ever been identified.<ref>[https://www.theglobeandmail.com/servlet/story/RTGAM.20070105.wxmurder06/BNStory/National/home "Life in New Orleans turns tragic for Canadians"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080822144449/http://www.theglobeandmail.com/servlet/story/RTGAM.20070105.wxmurder06/BNStory/National/home |date=2008-08-22 }} The Globe & Mail, January 6, 2007</ref> * During a 19 February 2007, convoy to the [[Central American Parliament]] in [[Guatemala city]], one car carrying three [[National Republican Alliance|ARENA]] party members of the El Salvadoran Congress, abruptly left the others for a dirt road near El Jocotillo. [[February 2007 Salvadoran congressmen killings|The burnt and tortured bodies of all three, along with their driver]], were found in the vehicle a short distance away the following day. Four Guatemalan police officers were arrested shortly afterwards, but then were killed in prison two weeks later. Attempts to further investigate the crimes have resulted in either acquittals of suspects or the murders of investigating officials. * [[Murder of Frank Newbery|Frank Newbery]] was beaten to death inside his convenience store at [[Cooks Hill, New South Wales|Cooks Hill]], Australia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.police.nsw.gov.au/can_you_help_us/rewards/100000_reward/20071009_reward_to_solve_newcastle_murder|publisher=NSW Police Force|title=Reward of $100,000 to solve murder of Frank Newberry|accessdate=28 November 2017}}</ref> * Colorado marijuana activist [[Ken Gorman]] (51), was shot and killed in his home on 17 February 2007. The case remains open. * On the morning of 21 July 2007, the strangled body of [[Murder of Snehal Gaware|Snehal Gaware]] (27), was found in a drawer under her bed in her home in the [[Mumbai]] suburb of [[Dombivili]]. It was believed she had been killed the previous day. Her boyfriend was charged with her murder, but acquitted in 2011 after the case against him was found lacking. No other suspects have ever been named. * Almost a month after she was last seen being forced into a van at a [[Kuala Lumpur]], [[Malaysia]] [[wet market]], the body of 8-year-old [[Murder of Nurin Jazlin|Nurin Jazlin]] was found stuffed in a bag outside a [[Petaling Jaya]] shop. She had apparently died hours earlier of a bacterial infection resulting from injuries sustained during a sexual assault. Several suspects were arrested but eventually released for lack of evidence; police have released a CCTV video showing the body being discarded by a motorcyclist, as well as several other people who may have been involved. However, they have not been able to identify any of them. * [[Murder of Paul Quinn|Paul Quinn]] (21), died on 20 October 2007 in [[Drogheda|Drogheda, Ireland]], after being beaten with farm implements by a group of people with such length and severity as to break every major bone in his body. It is believed his death was the result of a feud with local IRA members. No suspects have been named. * [[John Pezzenti]] (55), a wildlife photographer, was found shot dead in his [[Anchorage, Alaska]], apartment 3 December 2007. Neither a motive nor a suspect has emerged from the investigation. * [[Lane Bryant shooting]] – on 2 February 2008, a gunman trying to rob a [[Lane Bryant]] store in the Brookside Marketplace in Tinley Park, Illinois killed five women (a manager and four customers). The shooter has not been apprehended, although police do not consider it a "[[cold case]]" yet.<ref name=reut>{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/newsOne/idUSN0244670020080203|publisher=Reuters |date=2008-02-02 |accessdate=27 November 2014|title=Five women killed in Chicago-area store shooting}}</ref> * On that same date, in [[Saanich, British Columbia]], real-estate agent [[Murder of Lindsay Buziak|Lindsay Buziak]] (25), was stabbed 40 times while showing a house to an unknown couple described as speaking accented English. Her boyfriend, whom she had expressed reservations about the viewing to, since the couple had claimed to have been referred to her by a coworker who was unreachable at the time, had been waiting outside for part of the time, was taken into custody along with a friend but later cleared. Police believe the attack was a professional hit since Buziak was stabbed from behind without any defensive wounds and the couple had made the appointment with a disposable cell phone. The investigation is continuing. * [[2008 Noida double murder case|Aarushi Talwar (13), and Hemraj Banjade (45),]] were murdered on the night of 15–16 May 2008 at Aarushi's home in [[Noida]], [[India]]. Aarushi's parents were first suspected and charged, but the charges were dropped and their domestic servants became suspects. Then her parents were again charged, and were convicted and sentenced to life imprisonment, but were exonerated after an appeal in the High Court. No other arrests have been made and the murderer is unknown.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com/news/world/2013/01/26/aarushi_talwar_murder_a_look_at_one_of_indias_most_notorious_cases.html|accessdate=13 October 2017|title=Aarushi Talwar murder: Inside story of India's most controversial trial|date=26 January 2013|publisher=The Star – thestar.com}}</ref> * [[Malalai Kakar]] (41), the highest-ranking woman in the Afghan police force, was shot and killed by an unknown assassin while leaving her [[Kandahar]] home for work on 28 September 2008. No suspects have been officially named although it is believed that the [[Taliban]] may be connected to the crime. * The [[Fond du Lac County Jane Doe]], found on 23 November 2008 in Ashford, Wisconsin. No arrests have been made and her body has never been identified.<ref name=baffles>{{cite news|title=Cold Cases: Wisconsin Jane Doe baffles detective |url=http://www.wisconsinrapidstribune.com/article/20130801/WRT019804/308010354/Cold-Cases-Wisconsin-Jane-Doe-baffles-detective-video- |accessdate=25 July 2014 |agency=Wisconsin Rapids Tribune |date=1 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140727214821/http://www.wisconsinrapidstribune.com/article/20130801/WRT019804/308010354/Cold-Cases-Wisconsin-Jane-Doe-baffles-detective-video- |archivedate=27 July 2014 |df= }}</ref>
===2010s=== * [[Assassination of Mahmoud Al-Mabhouh|Mahmoud al-Mabhouh]] (52), a senior military commander of the Palestinian radical group [[Hamas]] and cofounder of the [[Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades]], its military wing, was found dead in his [[Dubai]] hotel room on January 19, 2010. Initially his death was thought to be from natural causes, and Hamas, in a public statement, attributed it to cancer, but later investigation showed that he had been injected with [[suxamethonium chloride]] to paralyze him and then suffocated with a pillow. The Dubai police circulated pictures of 20 guests and visitors believed to have been associated with the killing, whom they suggested were operatives of Israel's foreign intelligence service, the [[Mossad]]. Many had entered the [[United Arab Emirates]] on forged passports from other Western countries; the disclosures caused diplomatic tensions between those countries and Israel but did not lead to any public arrests or identifications.<ref>{{cite news|last=McGregor-Wood|first=Simon|title=Dubai Hit: Police Say They Know How Mahmoud al-Mabhouh Was Killed|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Blotter/dubai-hit-police-mahmoud-al-mabhouh-killed/story?id=9973592|newspaper=[[ABC News]]|date=March 1, 2010|accessdate=August 7, 2010}}</ref> * [[Murder of Lorenzo González Cacho|Lorenzo González Cacho]] (8), of [[Dorado, Puerto Rico]], was pronounced dead on arrival at a clinic his mother brought him to on March 9, 2010. She claimed his injuries had resulted from a fall from bed; this was contradicted by an autopsy which revealed severe facial and head wounds, as well as some stabbing injuries. She and several other people in the house at the time have been publicly identified as suspects, but not charged.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.primerahora.com/noticias/policia-tribunales/nota/anacachoessospechosadesdeelprimerdiareiterasomoza-608698/|title=Ana Cacho es sospechosa desde el primer día reitera Somoza|publisher=Primera Hora|date=2012-02-02|accessdate=27 November 2014}}</ref> * The body of [[Namibia]]n schoolgirl [[Murder of Magdalena Stoffels|Magdalena Stoffels]] (17), was found in a river near [[Windhoek, Namibia|Windhoek]] on July 27, 2010; she had been raped and then murdered. Police arrested a local man they found washing some clothing in a nearby portion of the river shortly afterward and charged him with the crime due to scratches on his body and what they believed were bloodstains on the clothing. A year later, he was released because the forensic evidence did not provide any stronger link to the crime. The investigation is continuing. * The badly decomposed body of former NBA player [[Lorenzen Wright]] (34), was found in woods near his [[Collierville, Tennessee]], home on 28 July 2010, ten days after he had last been seen, with several gunshot wounds. Records showed that his cell phone had been used to make a 9-1-1 call that was interrupted by gunshots shortly after he disappeared; it had not lasted long enough for its location to be fully established. The case remains unsolved. However, in December 2017, over seven years after his death, Wright's ex-wife Sherra Wright-Robinson was charged with his murder. * A worker at a landfill outside [[Wilmington, Delaware]], spotted the body of [[John P. Wheeler III]] (66), founder of the [[Vietnam Veterans Memorial Fund]], contract employee of Mitre Corp., and an official who had served in the Department of Defense under Republican administrations, in some waste being unloaded on 31 December 2010. He had been beaten to death sometime after being seen at an intersection downtown the preceding afternoon; witnesses who had seen him in various locations around Wilmington over the previous two days said he had appeared somewhat confused and disoriented but sober, claiming at one point to have been robbed, but refused offers of help. He was reportedly involved in a feud with a neighbor and may have been involved in an attempted arson; no suspects have emerged.<ref name="John Wheeler">{{cite news|title=Witnesses: Wheeler Appeared Disoriented, Disheveled Prior to Death|url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2011/01/05/witnesses-wheeler-appeared-disoriented-disheveled-prior-death/?test=latestnews|newspaper=[[Fox News]]|date=January 5, 2011|accessdate=November 12, 2014}}</ref> * [[Muzafar Bhutto]] (41), a [[Sindhi nationalism|Sindhi nationalist]] politician in [[Pakistan]], was last seen alive 24 February 2011. His body, with many gunshot wounds, was found near a [[Hyderabad, Sindh|Hyderabad]] bypass fourteen months later. No suspects have been officially identified. * On the afternoon of 12 September 2011, [[2011 Waltham triple murder|Brendan Mess, Erik Weissman, and Raphael Teken]] were found with their throats cut almost to the point of decapitation in different rooms of Mess's [[Waltham, Massachusetts]] apartment, their bodies sprinkled with $5,000 in cash and seven pounds of marijuana, an amount having an even higher street value at the time, suggesting robbery had not been the motive. It was determined that the three had been killed the previous evening. After [[Tamerlan Tsarnaev]] was killed by police following the [[Boston Marathon bombing]] a year and a half later, which his brother [[Dzhokhar Tsarnaev|Dzhokhar]] was later convicted of perpetrating, it was disclosed that he had been suspected of involvement in the Waltham murders, due in part to his acquaintanceship with one of the victims. [[Ibragim Todashev]], another friend of Tsarnaev's who had been suspected of involvement, was killed when he reacted violently during an FBI interrogation shortly after the bombings. Police still suspect Dzhokhar, sentenced to death in 2015 for his role in the bombings, of being involved as well, but have not formally charged him. * Married Bangladeshi journalists [[Murder of Sagar Sarowar and Meherun Runi|Sagar Sarowar and Meherun Runi]], both 27, were found stabbed to death in their [[Dhaka]] apartment on February 11, 2012. Their deaths, of all the [[List of journalists killed in Bangladesh|many murders of journalists in the country]], drew protests and public outrage both in Bangladesh and abroad. Both were working on stories at the time that could have led to violent reprisals. The government initially promised to have suspects in custody within days, but to date no arrests have been made. * [[Bashir Ahmed Qureshi]], 54, another Sindhi nationalist leader, suddenly collapsed during a dinner with members of his party on April 7, 2012 in Sakrand, Pakistan. He died in hospital early the next morning.
